summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides updates on victim counts, interviews, evidence reviews, and proffer sessions with potential cooperators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as a co-conspirator under investigation; the email discusses how many victims can speak about her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the email provides status updates on the case against him.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator in the Epstein investigation, with the email discussing victims who can speak about her involvement.

events.title: Proffer with former NY Epstein employee
events.description: A proffer session was conducted with a former employee of Epstein in New York.

events.title: Follow-up interview with Florida victim
events.description: A follow-up check-in interview was conducted with a victim in Florida.

events.title: Three victim interviews in NY
events.description: Three victims were interviewed in New York with their respective attorneys present.

events.title: Epstein status meeting with ADIC
events.description: A status meeting on the Epstein case was scheduled with the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) at the FBI New York office.

keyFacts: Approximately 75-80 victims were identified in the NY case, with about half interviewed in person or contacted via attorney.
The investigation involved reviewing two hard drives found in a safe for images and videos, which was completed.
Proffer sessions were conducted with cooperative individuals, including reverse proffers with unspecified persons and a proffer with a former Epstein employee in New York.
The email indicates not all victims could speak to the co-conspirators under investigation, specifically noting it was tough to estimate how many could speak about Ghislaine Maxwell.
Interview plans included confirmed interviews with 5 victims in California and previous interviews in Florida and New York.
